dublin_core.dcvalue: We propose the combination of a keyframe based monocular SLAM system and a global localization method The SLAM system runs locally on a camera equipped mobile client and provides continuous relative 6DoF pose estimation as well as keyframe images with computed camera locations As the local map expands a server process localizes the keyframes with a pre made globally registered map and returns the global registration correction to the mobile client The localization result is updated each time a keyframe is added and observations of global anchor points are added to the client side bundle adjustment process to further refine the SLAM map registration and limit drift The end result is a 6DoF tracking and mapping system which provides globally registered tracking in real time on a mobile device overcomes the difficulties of localization with a narrow field of view mobile phone camera and is not limited to tracking only in areas covered by the offline reconstruction
IEEE transactions on visualization and computer graphics
Global localization from monocular SLAM on a mobile phone.
